availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas P. Hughes (Louisville, Kentucky, clerk and merchant)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, clerk and merchant. Pennsylvania native. Married to Julia H. Hughes. Father of Henry Hughes, Mary "Maggie" Hughes, and Julia Hughes. Clerk in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Louisville in 1850. Merchant in Louisville in 1860. Employed Margaret May and M. Mance as servants in Louisville in 1860. Merchant in partnership with William Garvin, John Bell, Samuel Gwyn, Robert Russell, William W. Hinkle, and James Parkhill, in Garvin, Bell & Company in Louisville in 1861.
